Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether Passport Canada can revoke a passport under CPO s.10(2)(b) without a conviction for an indictable offense
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: No charges or conviction related to forgery; passport had expired
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On Passport Canada to establish basis for revocation
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Not applicable – no finding on credibility due to lack of proceedings
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Section 10(2)(b) requires either a conviction or use in an indictable offense; expired passport cannot be revoked
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Revocation without charge or conviction and after expiration
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Lack of legal authority for revocation
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Decision found procedurally flawed due to absence of conviction
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Expired passport, no criminal charges or conviction
Crimes.Legal_Framework: Administrative law and Canadian Passport Order
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Revocation of passport and refusal of services
Crimes.Defendant_Response: No formal response detailed; decision based on allegations
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Documentary (passport status), absence of criminal record
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Quashing of revocation and service refusal
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Alleged possession and use of forged passport

Crimes.Crime_Name: Misrepresentation under the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether revocation under CPO s.10(2)(b) is valid without conviction for an indictable offense
Crimes.Governing_Law: Canadian Passport Order; Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: No determination made due to lack of charges
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Allegations of tampering, no forensic or criminal evidence
Crimes.Evaluation_Standard: Legality and reasonableness of administrative action
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Absence of criminal conviction or clear evidence
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Requirement of conviction or clear evidence under CPO
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of admissible evidence supporting forgery
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Violation – decision made without due process or proof
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to establish legal basis prior to revocation

Crimes.Crime_Name: Attempting to enter Canada with a forged document
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether Minister can revoke passport under CPO s.10(2)(b) without conviction
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Passport was tampered with but no conviction obtained
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On Passport Canada to justify revocation
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Not evaluated – decision based on legal insufficiency
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Revocation under s.10(2)(b) requires conviction or unexpired status
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Revocation after passport expiration and without conviction
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Lack of jurisdictional prerequisites for revocation
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Unfair due to lack of evidentiary basis
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Seizure of tampered passport, expiration date
Crimes.Defendant_Response: No public record of defense provided
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Set aside revocation and restore service eligibility
Crimes.Remedy_Sought: Judicial review and relief from administrative penalties
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Use of forged document to attempt entry
Crimes.Pending_Relief_or_Application: Request for issuance of new passport
